title: "Tunisia's Decree Won't Stop Fake News. It Will Stop Free Speech"
excerpt: "Following Tunisia's revolution in 2011, which heralded uprisings across the Arab world, the country came to enjoy one of the most open media environments in the region. Journalism has thrived, with outlets able to scrutinise political leaders and critically discuss the direction of the nation."
